HL7 Standard.summary: This Implementation Guide (ITI.mXDE) primarily leverages FHIR for its core functionality, defining a specific Provenance profile to link extracted data elements (FHIR resources) to their source documents. It heavily relies on other IHE profiles like QEDm (which itself is built on a mix of HL7 standards) for querying and MHD/XDS for document sharing, indicating a cross-paradigm approach. While it acknowledges the existence of structured documents, it doesn't directly utilize CDA's specific structures or exchange mechanisms. There's no mention or use of HL7 v2 or v3.

Geographic Scope.summary: This Implementation Guide is part of the IHE IT Infrastructure (ITI) domain and defines a profile for Mobile Cross-Enterprise Document Data Element Extraction (mXDE). It focuses on technical specifications for accessing and utilizing data elements extracted from clinical documents within a health information exchange. It leverages existing IHE profiles and does not specify any regional or national adaptations.

Domain Focus.summary: The mXDE IG primarily focuses on enabling access to structured clinical data elements extracted from clinical documents within a health information exchange. It leverages existing IHE profiles for document sharing (XDS, MHD) and data element querying (QEDm) and defines a specific Provenance pattern to link extracted data elements back to their source documents. This facilitates clinical decision support, improves data usability, and enhances patient access to their health information. While it touches upon administrative aspects through its reliance on document sharing infrastructure, its core purpose is to bridge the gap between document-level and data element-level access in a clinical context.

Implementers.summary: The mXDE IG focuses on enabling access to fine-grained data elements extracted from clinical documents shared within a health information exchange. It primarily targets EHR systems and systems that consume clinical data, such as Clinical Decision Support and PHR systems. It also has implications for research platforms that need access to structured data. The IG does not directly involve Payer, Pharmacy, Imaging, or Lab systems.

Users & Stakeholders.summary: The ITI mXDE IG primarily targets systems and users involved in accessing and utilizing fine-grained data extracted from clinical documents within a health information exchange. Clinical Care Teams are the core users, as they need to query specific data elements and trace back to source documents for clinical decision support. Research Organizations also have a significant role, as they can leverage structured data elements for research purposes. Patients and Caregivers benefit indirectly through improved data access via PHRs. Public Health Agencies and Payers have limited involvement, while Government Agencies have minimal needs addressed by this IG.
